issue.title: Cleanup test_code_quality.py
issue.body:
for diofant/diofant#215
- [x] carriage returns at EOL
- [x] ~~generic exceptions~~
- [x] self/cls assignments, see https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/977

body: I would imagine this would be useful in the case of classes, so I am okay with having a new check for this. Unfortunately, I am pretty busy, so I can't promise when a thing like this would happen, a pull request would be better now, since it can move things forward.

issue.title: Implement pylint checker for self/cls assignments

milestone.description: Improve polys module, root isolation for polynomials with algebraic coefficients

issue.body: See PyCQA/pylint#977.  And be sure it's enabled in our flake8 tests.

body: To any new contributors, this will require adding a check to `VariablesChecker` with a new warning. For each visited assign node, check if it exists in an instance method or class method, and if it does then make sure that the assignment isn't to the first argument, regardless of it's name.
What text would you like in the warning?
Perhaps something like "Invalid assignment to %s in method" and pass it the name of the argument that is assigned to?

@PCManticore, I'm not sure if that's a right fix.

This will work for simple cases:
```
(pylint) sk@note:~ $ cat a.py 
class A:
    def foo(self, bar):
        self = bar
        print(self)

a = A()
a.foo(42)
(pylint) sk@note:~ $ pylint -d all -e W0642 a.py 
No config file found, using default configuration
************* Module a
a.py:3:8: W0642: Invalid assignment to self in method (self-cls-assignment)

------------------------------------------------------------------
Your code has been rated at 8.33/10 (previous run: 6.67/10, +1.67)
(pylint) sk@note:~ $ python3 a.py 
42
```

But not in general:
```
(pylint) sk@note:~ $ cat b.py 
class B:
    def foo(self, bar):
        def spam(x):
            nonlocal self
            self = x
        spam(bar)
        print(self)

b = B()
b.foo(42)
(pylint) sk@note:~ $ pylint -d all -e W0642 b.py 
No config file found, using default configuration

--------------------------------------------------------------------
Your code has been rated at 10.00/10 (previous run: 10.00/10, +0.00)
(pylint) sk@note:~ $ python3 b.py 
42
```

Should I open a new issue?
Yes please open a new issue
